thread.title: Massachusetts twins drive car into an icy swimming pool
thread.title_full: Massachusetts twins drive car into an icy swimming pool | Daily Mail Online

author: Keith Griffith For Dailymail.com
title: Massachusetts twins drive car into an icy swimming pool
text:
Two 17-year-old girls took a chilly dip on Wednesday, after driving their car off the road and into an icy pool.
The crash occurred around 7.30am on Easy Street in Uxbridge, Massachusetts, a town of 14,000 about 36 miles southwest of Boston.
The girls, who are twins, were on their way to Blackstone Valley Technical High School when police say their car struck a utility pole on nearby West River Road, WCVB reports .
Scroll down for video
Two 17-year-old girls took a chilly dip on Wednesday, after driving their car off the road and into an icy pool in Uxbridge, Massachusetts
Police say the crash unfolded when the car struck a utility pole on W. River Road. The car ended up in a pool several hundred feet from the road. The pair managed to escape by climbing out of the open doors
The car ended up partially submerged in the icy pool
The car, a 2002 Lexus SE, went careening off the road and into a yard in the well-manicured suburb.
Tire tracks on the snowy ground show that the car, now over 100 feet off the road, continued on into another yard and swerved in a wide arc before plowing directly into a white wooden fence around the homeowner's pool.
The Lexus barreled through the fence and directly into the pool, deploying the front and side door airbags.
Photos of the scene also show the car's sunroof open, suggested the teens may have initially tried to escape through the roof of the Lexus
Unable to open the doors due to the airbag deployment, the twins scrambled into the car's back seat as the car sank in the icy waters.
Photos of the scene also show the car's sunroof open, suggested the teens may have initially tried to escape through the roof of the Lexus
The teens opened the rear passenger door of the Lexus and slipped out into the pool, the Boston Herald reported .
Homeowner Muhamed Alomar heard a sound 'like a bomb' while his wife was giving their three children breakfast.
Alomar ran out back and saw the chaotic scene.
'It's like dream, you know. It's more than reality,' he said. 'You would never expect a car to be in the middle of the pool with these two girls panicking.'
Alomar helped the twins out of the pool and hurried them inside to help them warm up.
The car traveled roughly 300 feet off the road before landing in the pool.
Police say driver inexperience was a factor in the incident.
